variables.name: SERVER_IP
variables.description: The IP address of the server where all services will be running. It wil typically be the IP address of your server in your local network/home network

variables.name: DOMAIN
variables.description: The following is the "rightmost" part of the URL to access the services. This must be a subdomain of a public domain you own. For example, if you own the domain "example.com", then you can use "home.example.com" as this domain.

sections.name: ADGUARD
sections.description: DNS server with ad blocking for the home network. See https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdGuardHome

variables.name: PASSWORD
variables.description: Password for the web interface. The username is "admin"

variables.name: CONF_PATH
variables.description: Path for AdGuard Home configuration files

variables.name: WORK_PATH
variables.description: Path for AdGuard Home working files

variables.name: CLOUDFLARE_API_TOKEN
variables.description: CloudFlare API token. You should create a new API token from CloudFlare Dashboard -> Profile -> API Tokens

variables.name: CLOUDFLARE_API_EMAIL
variables.description: CloudFlare API email. This is the email you used to log into CloudFlare to create the API token

sections.name: CALIBRE
sections.description: Service to store and convert ebooks. See https://github.com/crocodilestick/Calibre-Web-Automated

variables.name: INGEST_PATH
variables.description: Path for ebooks to be ingested

variables.name: LIBRARY_PATH
variables.description: Path where the Calibre library is stored

sections.name: PAPERLESS_WEB

variables.name: MEDIA_PATH
variables.description: Path for Paperless media files. This is where the original documents are stored

variables.name: EXPORT_PATH
variables.description: Path for Paperless export files. This is where Paperless will store the exported documents when we run the export script

sections.name: PAPERLESS_REDIS
sections.description: Redis database for the Paperless service

sections.name: PAPERLESS_DB

sections.name: IMMICH_WEB
sections.description: Photo and video management service. See https://github.com/immich-app/immich

variables.name: UPLOAD_PATH
variables.description: Path for Immich data. This is where original photos and videos are stored

sections.name: IMMICH_DB
sections.description: SQL database for the Immich service

variables.name: USER
variables.description: SQL database user. Warning: DO NOT CHANGE, or there will be problems when restoring data

sections.name: IMMICH_ML
sections.description: Container that adds machine learning capabilities to the Immich service

variables.name: CONTAINER_NAME
variables.description: The container's name. IMPORTANT: if this is NOT the default "immich-machine-learning", then this hostname has to be set in Immich's server settings via the web interface

sections.name: IMMICH_REDIS
sections.description: Redis database for the Immich service

sections.name: PORTAINER
sections.description: Service for managing Docker infrastructure. See https://github.com/portainer/portainer

variables.name: UPLOAD_PATH
variables.description: Path to upload files that Firefly can ingest

variables.name: APP_ENV
variables.description: You can leave this on "local". If you change it to production most console commands will ask for extra confirmation. Never set it to "testing".

variables.name: APP_DEBUG
variables.description: Set to true if you want to see debug information in error screens.

variables.name: SITE_OWNER
variables.description: This should be your email address. The variable is used in some errors shown to users who aren't admin.

variables.name: APP_KEY
variables.description: The encryption key for your sessions. Keep this very secure. Change it to a string of exactly 32 chars. Avoid the character #, it may break things

variables.name: DEFAULT_LANGUAGE
variables.description: Firefly III will launch using this language (for new users and unauthenticated visitors)

variables.name: DEFAULT_LOCALE
variables.description: The locale defines how numbers are formatted. By default this value is the same as whatever the language is.

variables.name: TRUSTED_PROXIES
variables.description: Useful variable when using Docker and/or a reverse proxy. Set it to ** and reverse proxies work just fine.

variables.name: LOG_CHANNEL
variables.description: The log channel defines where your log entries go to. Several options exist. You can use 'single' for one big fat error log (not recommended). Also available are 'syslog', 'errorlog' and 'stdout' which will log to the system itself. A rotating log option is 'daily', creates 5 files that (surprise) rotate. A cool option is 'papertrail' for cloud logging. Default setting 'stack' will log to 'daily' and to 'stdout' at the same time.

variables.name: LOG_LEVEL
variables.description: Log level. You can set this from least severe to most severe: debug, info, notice, warning, error, critical, alert, emergency. If you set it to debug your logs will grow large, and fast. If you set it to emergency probably nothing will get logged, ever.

variables.name: AUDIT_LOG_LEVEL
variables.description: Audit log level. The audit log is used to log notable Firefly III events on a separate channel. These log entries may contain sensitive financial information. The audit log is disabled by default. To enable it, set AUDIT_LOG_LEVEL to "info". To disable it, set AUDIT_LOG_LEVEL to "emergency"

variables.name: AUDIT_LOG_CHANNEL
variables.description: If you want, you can redirect the audit logs to another channel. Set 'audit_stdout', 'audit_syslog', 'audit_errorlog' to log to the system itself. Use audit_daily to log to a rotating file. Use audit_papertrail to log to papertrail. If you do this, the audit logs may be mixed with normal logs because the settings for these channels are often the same as the settings for the normal logs

variables.name: DB_CONNECTION
variables.description: The database connection to use. For other database types, see the FAQ: https://docs.firefly-iii.org/references/faq/install/#i-want-to-use-sqlite

variables.name: MYSQL_USE_SSL
variables.description: MySQL supports SSL. You can configure it here. (NOTE: several related environment variables omitted by me...)

variables.name: CACHE_DRIVER
variables.description: The cache driver. If you're looking for performance improvements, you could install memcached or redis. (NOTE: all Redis config variables are omitted by me...)

variables.name: COOKIE_PATH
variables.description: The cookie path. It should not be necessary to change any cookie settings

variables.name: COOKIE_DOMAIN
variables.description: The cookie domain. It should not be necessary to change any cookie settings

variables.name: COOKIE_SECURE
variables.description: The cookie secure flag. It should not be necessary to change any cookie settings

variables.name: COOKIE_SAMESITE
variables.description: The cookie samesite flag. It should not be necessary to change any cookie settings. Setting to "strict" may give you trouble logging in

variables.name: ENABLE_EXTERNAL_MAP
variables.description: Set this value to true if you want to set the location of certain things, like transactions. Since this involves an external service, it's optional and disabled by default. (NOTE: some other environment variables related to the map omitted by me...)

variables.name: ENABLE_EXCHANGE_RATES
variables.description: Enable or disable exchange rate conversion

variables.name: ENABLE_EXTERNAL_RATES
variables.description: Set this value to true if you want Firefly III to download currency exchange rates from the internet. These rates are hosted by the creator of Firefly III inside an Azure Storage Container. Not all currencies may be available. Rates may be wrong.

variables.name: AUTHENTICATION_GUARD
variables.description: Firefly III supports a few authentication methods, such as 'web' (default, uses built in DB) or 'remote_user_guard' (for Authelia etc). Read more about these settings in the documentation: https://docs.firefly-iii.org/how-to/firefly-iii/advanced/authentication/

variables.name: USE_RUNNING_BALANCE
variables.description: Disable or enable the running balance column data. Please disable this. It's a very experimental feature

variables.name: LAYOUT
variables.description: The v2 layout is very experimental. If it breaks you get to keep both parts. Be wary of data loss

variables.name: QUERY_PARSER_IMPLEMENTATION
variables.description: Which Query Parser implementation to use for the search engine and rules. 'new' is experimental, 'legacy' is the classic one

sections.name: FIREFLY_DB
sections.description: SQL database for the Firefly service

sections.name: BACKUP
sections.description: Variables for the backup scripts that use Restic with Backblaze B2. These variables do not correspond to any container

variables.name: RESTIC_REPOSITORY
variables.description: The repository to use for backups

variables.name: RESTIC_PASSWORD
variables.description: The password to use for Restic. It is used to encrypt the backup files

variables.name: PATH
variables.description: Path to save the backup files into. Please note, all data you want to backup will be copy-pasted into this folder. Make sure you have enough disk space

variables.name: RETENTION_DAYS
variables.description: How many days to keep the backup files. Backups older than this number of days will be purged
